obit_text: Obituary for Jean Swartz   Rawlings Funeral Home Rawlings Funeral Home Jean Swartz November 5, 1929 ~ November 19, 2019 (age 90) Jean Evelyn Swartz of Sevierville, Tennessee went home to be with the Lord Tuesday, November 19, 2019. Jean was a member of Kodak United Methodist Church and is preceded in death by her Husband, Virgil and Grandson Gary Swartz. She is survived by her Children, Gerald (Camilla) Swartz, Judith (Christopher) Smith, Carolyn Carlisle, and Gregory (Sandra) Swartz; 10 Grandchildren and 2 Step-Grandchildren; 8 Great-Grandchildren; and 2 Great-Great Grandchildren. Visitation will be held at Kodak United Methodist Church, Friday, November 22, 2019 from 11:00am -12:30pm, service to follow Rev. Melissa Smith officiating. Graveside will be held at Henry's Crossroad Cemetery at 1:00pm meeting at the cemetery floral section. Friday November 22, 2019 11:00 AM to 12:30 PM Kodak United Methodist Church Friday November 22, 2019 12:30 PM 1:00 PM Henry Crossroad Cemetery 2941 Douglas Dam Rd Koda, TN 37764
name: Jean Swartz

obit_text: Marilyn Denise Manns - West Georgia Crematory   Cremation in Austell, Georgia   Cremation in GA West Georgia Crematory   Cremation in Austell, Georgia   Cremation in GA Marilyn Denise Manns, age 60, transitioned to heavenly existence on October 18,2019. An outstanding, exceptional woman of God, always available to assist someone in need, she cannot be replaced and will be missed. One of 4 children born to the union of Reverend Sam Jr. and Barbara Jean Chase, she was proceeded in death by them and her oldest brother, Sam III. Following her high school graduation from John Adams High School (South Bend, Indiana) she furthered her education at Beulah Heights University, receiving both a Bachelor of Arts (Summa Cum Laude) and a Master's degree in Business Administration. Entering the workforce, she was employed at Dyer and Payne as an administrative assistant for over 13 years. Marilyn considered her co-workers to be further extensions of her constantly expanding circle of family, friends, and acquaintances. Marilyn was a lifelong member of the Christian faith, as well as an associate minister at her beloved church, Fellowship of Prayer International. Phenomenally gifted as a singer, (from the age of 4) at FOPI she served as praise and worship leader in addition to her position on the ministerial staff. Worship was one of her most fervent passions, and leading God's people into worship was a task she handled inspirationally. Respected, and admired by her church family, she adored them as well, adopting them all into her extended family circle. In 1976, she started a 43-year marital journey by marrying her high school sweetheart (Danny Ronell), who survives her. She is also survived by her 3 cherished and treasured daughters, Donyalla Manns, Darra McClendon (Shaine), and Danica Manns, her most prized gem, granddaughter Hayley, her beloved sister (and best friend) Sabrina Chase, her adored brother, Reverend Michael R. Chase (Michelle), and current family patriarch Uncle Simuel Chase. The survivors list also include a host of nieces, nephews, God-children, friends, acquaintances, special friends and associates. Marilyn was the definition of a people person and added almost daily to this list. There will be a celebration of Marilyn's life of accomplishments on Saturday October 26, 2019 at 5 pm at Fellowship of Prayer International Church, 3940 Cascade Road, Atlanta GA, 30331. (Pastor Richard A. Goode presiding)
name: Marilyn Denise Manns

obit_text: Tribute for Beverly Lou Carter Lawson   Malone Funeral Home Malone Funeral Home Beverly Lou Carter Lawson November 29, 1958 ~ November 17, 2019 (age 60) Tribute & Services Beverly Lou Lawson, 60 of Grayson went to be with her Lord on Sunday, November 17, 2019 in Hospice Care Center in Ashland. Beverly was born November 29, 1958 in Ashland, KY, a daughter of Louise Griffey Carter of Grayson and the late Darrell Carter Sr. She is survived by her husband of 15 years, William Lawson; three sons, Josh (Chad Saunders) Morgan, Anthony Little and Billy Lawson all of Grayson; one daughter, Deanna (Josh) Harris of Grayson; one brother, Zane (Janie) Carter of Grayson; five grandchildren, Hannah Sloas, Caleb Sloas, Gage Harris, Madison Watkins and Tristan Watkins. Funeral services will be conducted Wednesday, 1:00 p.m. at Malone Funeral Home. Burial will be in the Carter Family Cemetery. Friends may call Wednesday from 11:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. at Malone Funeral Home. Condolences and memories may be sent to the Lawson family at www.malonefuneralhome.com. floral section. November 20, 2019 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM Malone Funeral Home 325 Malone Lane Grayson, KY 41143 November 20, 2019 1:00 PM to TBD Malone Funeral Home 325 Malone Lane Grayson, KY 41143 Carter Family Cemetery Evermans Creek Grayson, KY 41143
name: Beverly Lou Carter Lawson
